data.title: Awards & Honors

Barry Barish - Recipient of the 2016 Enrico Fermi Prize of the Italian Physical Society for his "fundamental role in the first direct detection of gravitational waves and the discovery of binary black hole mergers"

Jamie Bock - Recipient of the 2016 American Astronomical Society Joseph Weber Award

Ronald Drever - Recipient of the 2016 Shaw Prize in Astronomy for conceiving and designing LIGO; Honored for his role in the foundation of LIGO, recipient of the Special Breakthrough Prize in Fundamental Physics recognizing the LIGO scientists and engineers who contributed to the detection of gravitational waves.

Fiona Harrison - Recipient of the 2016 Massey Award from the Committee on Space Research (COSPAR)

Philip Hopkins - Recipient of the 2016 American Astronomical Society Helen B. Warner Prize

Shri Kulkarni - Appointed as a member of the Royal Netherlands Academy of Arts & Science

Barry Simon - Awarded the 2016 Leroy Steele Prize for Lifetime Achievement by the American Mathematical Society

Maria Spiropulu - Selected to serve on the U.S. Department of Energy and the NSF High Energy Physics Advisory Panel

Kip Thorne - Recipient of the 2016 Shaw Prize in Astronomy for conceiving and designing LIGO; Honored for his role in the foundation of LIGO, recipient of the Special Breakthrough Prize in Fundamental Physics recognizing the LIGO scientists and engineers who contributed to the detection of gravitational waves.

Rochus E. Vogt - Honored for his "important contributions" that lead to the success of LIGO, recipient of the Special Breakthrough Prize in Fundamental Physics recognizing the LIGO scientists and engineers who contributed to the detection of gravitational waves.

Sean Carroll - Fellow of the John Simon Guggenheim Memorial Foundation
